part.name: instruction
part.p: The ability for the manufacturer and/or supporting entity to broadcast and distribute information related to cybersecurity of the IoT device.

part.name: statement
part.p: The data, personnel, devices, systems, and facilities that enable the organization to achieve business purposes are identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organization’s risk strategy.

part.name: statement
part.p: Physical devices and systems within the organization are inventoried

part.name: statement
part.p: Software platforms and applications within the organization are inventoried

part.name: statement
part.p: Organizational communication and data flows are mapped

part.name: statement
part.p: External information systems are catalogued

part.name: statement
part.p: Resources (e.g., hardware, devices, data, time, personnel, and software) are prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value

part.name: statement
part.p: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) are established

part.name: statement
part.p: The organization’s mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.

part.name: statement
part.p: The organization’s role in the supply chain is identified and communicated

part.name: statement
part.p: The organization’s place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector is identified and communicated

part.name: statement
part.p: Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated

part.name: statement
part.p: Dependencies and critical functions for delivery of critical services are established

part.name: statement
part.p: Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services are established for all operating states (e.g. under duress/attack, during recovery, normal operations)

part.name: statement
part.p: The policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of cybersecurity risk.

part.name: statement
part.p: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established and communicated

part.name: statement
part.p: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with internal roles and external partners

part.name: statement
part.p: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are understood and managed

part.name: statement
part.p: Governance and risk management processes address cybersecurity risks

part.name: statement
part.p: The organization understands the cybersecurity risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals.

part.name: statement
part.p: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented

part.name: statement
part.p: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources

part.name: statement
part.p: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented

part.name: statement
part.p: Potential business impacts and likelihoods are identified

part.name: statement
part.p: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine risk

part.name: statement
part.p: Risk responses are identified and prioritized

part.name: statement
part.p: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support operational risk decisions.

part.name: statement
part.p: Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

part.name: statement
part.p: Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed

part.name: statement
part.p: The organization’s determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector specific risk analysis

part.name: statement
part.p: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing supply chain risk. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess and manage supply chain risks.

part.name: statement
part.p: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

part.name: statement
part.p: Suppliers and third party partners of information systems, components, and services are identified, prioritized, and assessed using a cyber supply chain risk assessment process

part.name: statement
part.p: Contracts with suppliers and third-party partners are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organization’s cybersecurity program and Cyber Supply Chain Risk Management Plan.

part.name: statement
part.p: Suppliers and third-party partners are routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual obligations.

part.name: statement
part.p: Response and recovery planning and testing are conducted with suppliers and third-party providers

part.name: instruction
part.p: Develop and implement appropriate safeguards to ensure delivery of critical services.

control.title: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control

part.name: statement
part.p: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities is limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions.

part.name: statement
part.p: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes

part.name: statement
part.p: Physical access to assets is managed and protected

part.name: statement
part.p: Remote access is managed

part.name: statement
part.p: Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties

part.name: statement
part.p: Network integrity is protected (e.g., network segregation, network segmentation)

part.name: statement
part.p: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials and asserted in interactions

part.name: statement
part.p: Users, devices, and other assets are authenticated (e.g., single-factor, multi-factor) commensurate with the risk of the transaction (e.g., individuals’ security and privacy risks and other organizational risks)

part.name: statement
part.p: The organization’s personnel and partners are provided cybersecurity awareness education and are trained to perform their cybersecurity-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements.

part.name: statement
part.p: All users are informed and trained

part.name: statement
part.p: Privileged users understand their roles and responsibilities

part.name: statement
part.p: Third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) understand their roles and responsibilities

part.name: statement
part.p: Senior executives understand their roles and responsibilities

part.name: statement
part.p: Physical and cybersecurity personnel understand their roles and responsibilities

part.name: statement
part.p: Information and records (data) are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information.

part.name: statement
part.p: Data-at-rest is protected

part.name: statement
part.p: Data-in-transit is protected

part.name: statement
part.p: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition

part.name: statement
part.p: Adequate capacity to ensure availability is maintained

part.name: statement
part.p: Protections against data leaks are implemented

part.name: statement
part.p: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify software, firmware, and information integrity

part.name: statement
part.p: The development and testing environment(s) are separate from the production environment

part.name: statement
part.p: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify hardware integrity

part.name: statement
part.p: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets.

part.name: statement
part.p: A baseline configuration of information technology/industrial control systems is created and maintained incorporating security principles (e.g. concept of least functionality)

part.name: statement
part.p: A System Development Life Cycle to manage systems is implemented

part.name: statement
part.p: Configuration change control processes are in place

part.name: statement
part.p: Backups of information are conducted, maintained, and tested

part.name: statement
part.p: Policy and regulations regarding the physical operating environment for organizational assets are met

part.name: statement
part.p: Data is destroyed according to policy

part.name: statement
part.p: Protection processes are improved

part.name: statement
part.p: Effectiveness of protection technologies is shared

part.name: statement
part.p: Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery plans (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) are in place and managed

part.name: statement
part.p: Response and recovery plans are tested

part.name: statement
part.p: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices (e.g., deprovisioning, personnel screening)

part.name: statement
part.p: A vulnerability management plan is developed and implemented

part.name: statement
part.p: Maintenance and repairs of industrial control and information system components are performed consistent with policies and procedures.

part.name: statement
part.p: Maintenance and repair of organizational assets are performed and logged, with approved and controlled tools

part.name: statement
part.p: Remote maintenance of organizational assets is approved, logged, and performed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access

part.name: statement
part.p: Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements.

part.name: statement
part.p: Audit/log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy

part.name: statement
part.p: Removable media is protected and its use restricted according to policy

part.name: statement
part.p: The principle of least functionality is incorporated by configuring systems to provide only essential capabilities

part.name: statement
part.p: Communications and control networks are protected

part.name: statement
part.p: Mechanisms (e.g., failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations

part.name: instruction
part.p: Develop and implement appropriate activities to identify the occurrence of a cybersecurity event.

part.name: statement
part.p: Anomalous activity is detected and the potential impact of events is understood.

part.name: statement
part.p: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed

part.name: statement
part.p: Detected events are analyzed to understand attack targets and methods

part.name: statement
part.p: Event data are collected and correlated from multiple sources and sensors

part.name: statement
part.p: Impact of events is determined

part.name: statement
part.p: Incident alert thresholds are established

part.name: statement
part.p: The information system and assets are monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures.

part.name: statement
part.p: The network is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

part.name: statement
part.p: The physical environment is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

part.name: statement
part.p: Personnel activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

part.name: statement
part.p: Malicious code is detected

part.name: statement
part.p: Unauthorized mobile code is detected

part.name: statement
part.p: External service provider activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

part.name: statement
part.p: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed

part.name: statement
part.p: Vulnerability scans are performed

part.name: statement
part.p: Detection processes and procedures are maintained and tested to ensure awareness of anomalous events.

part.name: statement
part.p: Roles and responsibilities for detection are well defined to ensure accountability

part.name: statement
part.p: Detection activities comply with all applicable requirements

part.name: statement
part.p: Detection processes are tested

part.name: statement
part.p: Event detection information is communicated

part.name: statement
part.p: Detection processes are continuously improved

part.name: instruction
part.p: Develop and implement appropriate activities to take action regarding a detected cybersecurity incident.

part.name: statement
part.p: Response processes and procedures are executed and maintained, to ensure response to detected cybersecurity incidents.

part.name: statement
part.p: Response plan is executed during or after an incident

part.name: statement
part.p: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies).

part.name: statement
part.p: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed

part.name: statement
part.p: Incidents are reported consistent with established criteria

part.name: statement
part.p: Information is shared consistent with response plans

part.name: statement
part.p: Coordination with stakeholders occurs consistent with response plans

part.name: statement
part.p: Voluntary information sharing occurs with external stakeholders to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness

part.name: statement
part.p: Analysis is conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities.

part.name: statement
part.p: Notifications from detection systems are investigated

part.name: statement
part.p: The impact of the incident is understood

part.name: statement
part.p: Forensics are performed

part.name: statement
part.p: Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans

part.name: statement
part.p: Processes are established to receive, analyze and respond to vulnerabilities disclosed to the organization from internal and external sources (e.g. internal testing, security bulletins, or security researchers)

part.name: statement
part.p: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event, mitigate its effects, and resolve the incident.

part.name: statement
part.p: Incidents are contained

part.name: statement
part.p: Incidents are mitigated

part.name: statement
part.p: Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented as accepted risks

part.name: statement
part.p: Organizational response activities are improved by incorporating lessons learned from current and previous detection/response activities.

part.name: statement
part.p: Response plans incorporate lessons learned

part.name: statement
part.p: Response strategies are updated

part.p: Develop and implement appropriate activities to maintain plans for resilience and to restore any capabilities or services that were impaired due to a cybersecurity incident.

part.p: Recovery processes and procedures are executed and maintained to ensure restoration of systems or assets affected by cybersecurity incidents.

part.name: statement
part.p: Recovery plan is executed during or after a cybersecurity incident

part.name: statement
part.p: Recovery planning and processes are improved by incorporating lessons learned into future activities.

part.name: statement
part.p: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned

part.name: statement
part.p: Recovery strategies are updated

part.p: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties (e.g. coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors).
